{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3571774,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-28T22:49:50.645Z","cooked":"

Hello I’m a programmer for team 5130 currently trying to work on making our elevator utilize encoders along with PID control for smoother and more accurate motion. this would be a huge improvement over our current time and speed based elevator commands. However I’m currently having a problem with the code. I’ve checked off REV Hardware client to make sure our encoder is retrieving accurate data and that the motor orientation is not a problem. I’ve also tried to use the console to troubleshoot some of the problems. Right now when I hit a button the elevator just tried to move down instead of up, but it says that it is in fact increasing and reaching the target. after it thinks it’s reached the target, it accurately terminates the bottom position command (because it never left the bottom of the elevator)

I’ve tried to play around with a ton of values with no luck, I’m really unsure of where I’m going wrong, any help would be greatly appreciated. I’ve attached screenshots of our code, what the console is telling me, and the REV Hardware Client when I manually lift the elevator then hold if for a short period and then drop it back down.

Is there a reason you’re vying for a manual PID implementation rather than using wpilib’s PID class?

This is too complicated for me to analyze but PID controllers in general have DIRECTION. Typically you have output increasing when the error is positive but the reverse is possible. Maybe that’s what you are experiencing but not accommodating.

Toggling the feedforward based on the sign of the PID output makes very little sense; gravity doesn’t change directions for your mechanism, and even if it did, why would the output sign matter?

You’ll get more people willing to dive in if you post the code as either:
a. a link to an open repo online (github for example)
b. code as a pre-formatted text block

Code

Paste your elevator code here

No one is going to take the time to re-type your code from a series of five screenshots and figure it out.

the head of our elevator is quite heavy (much larger than most teams I’ve seen) such that the idea that compensation for the weight coming down is really a necessity. The Feedforward method which I only based off of output because I wanted to use the velocity/ rate of change of the elevator to signal the compensation. If you have any other ideas of a better method to signal such compensation I would totally be open to trying.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T14:52:46.790Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572218,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T14:56:02.653Z","cooked":"

Feedforwards are usually intended to bias the output to counter-act the effect of gravity (as you know).

You probably don’t want a discontinuity around a calculated pre-feedforward output of 0.

Gravity is a constant; your feedforward compensation should probably also be.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T14:56:02.653Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57662,"username":"Programming5130","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/8","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572219,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T14:56:11.638Z","cooked":"

I’ve definitely played around with the direction of the encoder and the elevator shaft. So I think it’s very possible that something is flipped. I’m going to be trying to figure it out today and that’s definitely where I’m going to start. this is my first time using anything like this so I’m definitely susceptible to beginner mistakes

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T14:56:11.638Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":10.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572220,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T14:58:56.223Z","cooked":"

public class ElevatorSubsystem extends SubsystemBase{

 private final SparkMax m_RightElevator = new SparkMax( 6, MotorType.kBrushless);
 private final SparkMax m_LeftElevator = new SparkMax(5, MotorType.kBrushless);

 private final double sprocketTeeth = 24;
 private final double chainPitch = 0.25;

 private final double inchesPerRotation = sprocketTeeth * chainPitch;

public ElevatorSubsystem(){
m_RightElevator.getEncoder().setPosition(0);
//m_LeftElevator.getEncoder().setPosition(0);
}

public void setSpeed(double speed){
    m_RightElevator.set(speed);
    m_LeftElevator.set(speed * -1);
}


public void stop(){
    m_RightElevator.set(0);
    m_LeftElevator.set(0);
}

public double getAveragePostionInches() {
    return m_RightElevator.getEncoder().getPosition() * inchesPerRotation;
}

public void resetEncoders(){
    m_RightElevator.getEncoder().setPosition(0);
    m_LeftElevator.getEncoder().setPosition(0);
}

}

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T14:58:56.223Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":10.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572221,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T14:59:26.403Z","cooked":"

public class MoveElevatorCommand extends Command {
private final ElevatorSubsystem elevator;
private final double targetInches;

// PID Constants //

private final double kP = 0.05;
private final double kD = 0.02;
private final double kI = 0.0;

private double lastError = 0;
private double errorSum = 0;

private double gravityFeedForward = 0.07;

private final double maxOutput = 0.8;
private final double minOutput = -0.3;

private final double tolerance = 0.5; // Inches

public MoveElevatorCommand(ElevatorSubsystem elevator, double targetInches) {
this.elevator = elevator;
this.targetInches = targetInches;
addRequirements(elevator);
}

@Override
public void initialize() {
lastError = 0;
errorSum = 0;
elevator.resetEncoders();
}

@Override
public void execute() {
double currentPosition = elevator.getAveragePostionInches();
double error = targetInches - currentPosition;
errorSum += error;
double derivative = error - lastError;

double output = (kP * error) + (kI * errorSum) + (kD * derivative);


if (output < 0){
  output += gravityFeedForward;
}

/* if (output < 0 && elevator.getAveragePostionInches() < 5.0){
gravityFeedForward = 0.1;
}
*/

//clamp to safe range
output = Math.max(minOutput, Math.min(maxOutput, output));

elevator.setSpeed(output);

lastError = error;

System.out.printf("Target: %.2f | Pos : %.2f | MotorPower: %.2f | Output : %.2f\n",
targetInches, currentPosition, output > 0 ? output:output + gravityFeedForward, output);

SmartDashboard.putNumber("Elevator Inches", elevator.getAveragePostionInches());

}

@Override
public boolean isFinished() {
double error = Math.abs(elevator.getAveragePostionInches() - targetInches);

return error < tolerance;

}

@Override
public void end(boolean interrupted) {
elevator.stop();
System.out.println("Elevator STOPPED at; " + elevator.getAveragePostionInches());
}
}

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T14:59:26.403Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":47,"readers_count":46,"score":9.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572226,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T15:03:22.586Z","cooked":"

I apologize for any stupidity on my part but, to my understanding our gravity feedforward is a constant that is then added to the output of the PID on the descent of the elevator (allegedly since its not working)

private double gravityFeedForward = 0.07;

if (output < 0){
output += gravityFeedForward;
}

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T15:03:22.586Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":13.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572236,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T15:21:53.131Z","cooked":"

You don’t want the if to be there.
You want to add the feedforward always (anytime when gravity is in effect).

You don’t want to encourage an oscillation around the setpoint by taking the feedforward term on and off. In particular, if the elevator settles to the exact correct position, and the PID terms result in 0 output, your code will suddenly remove the feedforward term, causing the elevator to sag, which will cause the PID term to command a positive output (without any feedforward), and eventually that will overcome the gravity and the position error, which will eventually be enough to command the elevator higher until such time as the PID terms go slightly negative, at which point the feedforward force will be added to the output (when the PID terms are trying to get the elevator to settle down), likely making it worse.

Edit to add:

Programming5130:

I apologize for any stupidity on my part

That’s not a thing that’s applicable here. You’re not being stupid at all; you’re approaching an new task with an open-minded and inquiring approach, both good things.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":29,"updated_at":"2025-03-29T15:28:12.668Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":8.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497258,"topic_slug":"elevator-encoder-based-pid-control","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/elevator-encoder-based-pid-control/497258/13","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3572249,"name":"","username":"person4268","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-29T15:43:30.944Z","cooked":"

There’s a handful of things I can say:

  • Your error derivative is (effectively) in terms of units of in / (20ms), rather than in/s. This is technically fine, but your D value will end up wanting to be much smaller, I think. Consider dividing your derivative term by 0.02 to convert that.
  • As others have said, yeah, you should be applying your gravity feedforward constantly. It’s (theoretically) what keeps your elevator when sagging when the pid controller is commanding 0 output. Also, the pid controller can command both negative and positive output, so you’d probably would want to check Math.abs(output) anyways.
  • I would personally keep the pid controller in the subsystem and have commands set setpoints for the elevator. This is a matter of personal preference though.
  • You were having issues with CanSparkMax because it was renamed to just SparkMax in 2025 Revlib.
  • It’ll probably be a bit nicer if you log all your numbers to smartdashboard instead of printing it, and use a tool like AdvantageScope to graph them. Rev Hardware Client’s graphs are pretty primitive. Also, System.out.println can be slow.

Also, you can use the wpilib PID controller with the spark max class. You just need to do motor.setVoltage(pidController.calculate(getPosition())), basically. It doesn’t directly take in the PID controller object, you’re responsible for periodically passing the pid output to the motor.

Alternatively, you could use on-motor controller pid, but it’s probably simpler at this point to just use the wpilib one imo.

Programming5130:

If you have any other ideas of a better method to signal such compensation I would totally be open to trying.

As others have said above: you should just be applying it unconditionally, at all times. There is no special case that changes the amount of gravity compensation needed for a simple elevator.

If having the compensation applied at all times results in bad system behavior, then you’re applying the wrong amount of compensation and need to re-tune.

You should follow the tutorial here, if you haven’t already:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Tuning a Vertical Elevator with Motion Profiling

In this section, we will tune a simple position controller for a vertical elevator. In addition, we will discuss the advantages of using motion profiling for this situation. About the Profiler: A M...

I would consider the approach of: (similar to person4268’s third bullet)

  • The elevator does not have a MoveElevatorCommand (and indeed is not even command-based).
  • Instead, it has a target position that can be updated
  • And then the elevator subsystem continually tries to PID[F] to that target position

Start the robot with the elevator targeting 0. When you want to go to L4, set the elevator target position to whatever is needed for L4.

At all times, the elevator subsystem is trying to maintain whatever the setpoint is. (It’s “elevator, please maintain this level forever” rather than “elevator, please wake up and move to this new level now”.)
